title: Oxfordshire Live: Monday 25 July - BBC News
summary: man dies after car crashes and catches fire in cowley .
cash and phones stolen in armed robbery at drayton pub .
councillors warn of 'wave of hostility ' after brexit vote .
oxford united owner confident club can keep appleton .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us for all of the news from across oxfordshire today .
we 'll be back at 08:00 tomorrow morning , so be sure to join us .

documents.title: warning over traffic impact on growth
text: the average speed of traffic in rush hour across the county fell from 14.2mph to 13.1mph between 2010 and 2014 , while rush-hour traffic on botley road took nearly 12 minutes to travel one mile .

documents.title: man charged after assault outside east hagbourne pub
text: police have now charged a 23-year-old man after a man suffered head injuries outside a pub near didcot at the weekend .
james mooney , from hersham road , hersham , walton-on-thames , surrey was charged last night with one count of gbh and one count of abh .
he was remanded in custody to appear at oxford magistrates ' court today .
the charges come after a man and a woman were assaulted outside the fleur de lys pub in east hagbourne .

documents.title: call to ban glyphosate weedkiller in oxford
text: the use of the weedkiller glyphosate in public spaces in oxford should be phased out over the next year , according to two green councillors .
they argue cities like barcelona , hamburg and paris stopped using it amid concerns from the world health organisation that the chemical causes cancer .

documents.title: garage theft warning on oxford 's woodstock road
text: be aware !
there have been garages broken into over the weekend on the woodstock road , bikes and tools have been taken .
c9316 bonneville

documents.title: three locked in pub cellar at knifepoint
text: three people are threatened with a knife and locked in a cellar during a late-night raid on an oxfordshire pub .

documents.title: oxford half marathon start line switched
text: organisers of @ twitterid marathon to switch start line from st giles to broad street for 2016 event on sun 9th oct .

documents.title: warning over traffic impact on economic growth
text: ever-worsening traffic congestion remains a `` key concern for businesses '' and will constrain economic growth , a new report has said .
work to improve road infrastructure in the county , it added , was `` unlikely to satisfy business expectations '' .
it highlighted figures which showed average traffic speeds had fallen to their lowest level in six years .
a council spokesman said work to improve infrastructure would `` reduce pressure '' on key roads .

text: 'wave of hostility ' after brexit vote

documents.title: anti-malaria drug could help fight cancer
text: a cheap and readily available anti-malaria drug could help radiotherapy destroy cancerous tumours , oxford researchers say .
atovaquone reduces the level of oxygen to cancer cells , which means they struggle to repair themselves following radiotherapy .
clinical trials in patients in oxford have begun , to see if the drug can reduce cancer cells ' ability to repair and spread to other parts of the body .
the cancer research uk study showed the drug was effective in a wide range of cancers , including lung , bowel , brain , and head and neck cancer .

documents.title: police release in rape investigation
text: thames valley police has released a cctv image of man who may have important information about a rape last year in oxford .
at about 02:00 on 14 march 2015 at the plush lounge , a woman in her 20s was met by a man who later raped her at an address in oxford .
police would like to speak to anyone who can identify the

documents.title: man in hospital after pub assault
text: a man suffered head injuries outside a pub near didcot at the weekend .
police and ambulance were called at about 23:30 on saturday to the fleur de lys pub in east hagbourne where a 25-year-old man had collapsed .
he was taken to the john radcliffe hospital in oxford , where he is being treated .
a 23-year-old man from walton-on-thames , surrey was arrested nearby on sus of gbh and is in custody .

documents.title: joggers in south oxfordshire are under threat
text: joggers in south oxfordshire are under threat

documents.title: man dies after car crash blaze
text: man dies after car crash blaze

documents.title: business fears as harwell road is closed for 10 weeks
text: businesses in harwell fear they will lose income because of the closure of the main road linking the village to didcot .
a section around blenheim hill will be shut for 10 weeks from today while drainage work is carried out for a new housing development .

documents.title: breakingman dies after cowley car fire
text: a man has died after a car left a road in cowley and caught fire overnight , police have confirmed .
the incident happened at about 02:40 on the b480 garsington road at the junction with hollow way .

documents.title: breakingarmed robbery at pub in drayton
text: police are investigating a robbery at a pub near abingdon overnight .
a thames valley police spokesperson said an `` aggravated burglary '' took place at about 03:45 at the red lion pub on abingdon road in drayton .
three men , who officers believe were armed with a knife entered the pub , and stole cash and two mobile phones .
no one is thought to have been injured in the raid .

documents.title: councillors warn of 'wave of hostility ' after brexit vote
text: ethnic minorities in oxford have experienced a `` wave of hostility '' since the eu referendum , councillors have warned .
a reported rise in `` casual racism '' showed a minority saw the brexit vote as a green light to abuse people .
the call comes after a muslim woman in oxford condemned the police response after she was called a terrorist during a road rage incident earlier this month .
thames valley police said they were investigating the incident and took hate crime `` extremely seriously '' .

text: lilley 's cup runneth over in her search for the best pub hanging baskets

documents.title: oxford 'can keep hold of appleton '
text: oxford 'can keep hold of appleton '

documents.title: cowley road closed after car fire
text: police say the b480 garsington road was closed overnight after a car left the road and caught fire .
a thames valley police spokesman said the incident happened at about 02:40 at the junction with hollow way in cowley .
fire crews were on the scene to deal with the car fire .
one man was injured , he added .
the road was closed but reopened at about 07:00 .

documents.title: bloomin ' beer gardens
text: it 's the height of summer and the holidays are here .
did you spend some of your weekend in a beer garden ?
the flower displays on our county 's pubs are looking fabulous , so lilley mitchell 's going on a floral pub crawl
bloomin ' marvellous !
fancy a floral pub crawl ?
the angel 's landlord , steve , creates a 25ft trough of colour .

documents.title: oxford councillors to debate 'wave of hostility ' towards migrants
text: there 's been a `` wave of hostility '' towards migrants in oxford in the wake of the vote to leave the eu , oxford city councillors are warning .
tonight they will discuss a cross-party motion condemning the `` reported rise in racism , xenophobia and hate crimes '' .
councillors also want `` the strongest representations '' to be made to protect the existing status and rights of eu citizens living in oxfordshire .

documents.title: travel latest : b480 reopens after 'serious police incident '
text: the b480 garsington road in cowley has now reopened after it was closed during the night for a `` serious police incident '' .
we 'll bring you more details as we get them .
get up-to-the minute details on these incidents , and the rest of the county 's travel news on the bbc travel site or follow @ bbcoxtravel .
b480 garsington road - both directions - open

documents.title: welcome to oxfordshire live
text: good morning .
good weekend ?
it 'll be dry with some sunshine today , though not as hot as it has been recently .
we 're starting the week as we mean to go on , with all the latest headlines here throughout the day .
do n't forget to let us know what 's happening in your area via email , facebook or twitter .
